info.title: OpenAPI Plant Store
info.description: A sample API that uses a plant store as an example to demonstrate features in the OpenAPI specification

post.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/auth/request-password-reset

### Request Description
This endpoint is used to initiate a request for resetting the user's password. The request should be sent as an HTTP POST to the specified URL with the user's email provided in the request body.

### Request Body
- email (string, required): The email address of the user for whom the password reset request is being initiated.

### Response Description
The response to this request will provide information about the status of the password reset request. The response body will include relevant details such as a success message or an error message, depending on the outcome of the request.

value.message: If an account exists for this email, a reset link has been sent.

post.description: Initiates a call session with a specified agent. The call is associated with the given agent ID and optionally a name for reference.

agentId.description: The ID of the agent to call

name.description: Name of the person or reference for the call

401.description: Unauthorized: User must be logged in

500.description: Internal server error while creating call

post.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/agents/validate-conversation

### API Request Description
This endpoint validates a conversation configuration for an agent. It checks if the conversation type, system instructions, and states are properly defined. Useful for ensuring the agent's workflow is correctly structured before deployment.

common.agent_information: You are a customer service agent.

x-codeSamples.label: cURL

post.description: Add a phone number to a user's account, associated with a specific integration (e.g., Twilio). The phone number is validated, saved, and linked to the user for future call-related operations.

400.description: Bad Request â€” Invalid input or phone number duplication

value.error: Phone number already exists for this user

get.description: Retrieve all knowledge bases associated with the authenticated user's organization.
Retrieve a single knowledge base by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the knowledge base

post.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/knowledgeBase/createKnowledgeBase

### API Request Description
This API endpoint allows users to create or update a knowledge base by uploading one or more files. Files are stored in Amazon S3, and a vector database collection is generated for semantic search.

### Request Body
- knowledgeBaseName (string): Name of the knowledge base to be created or updated.
- files (file[]): Files (PDF, DOCX, TXT, etc.) to be uploaded.

### Response Body
Upon successful execution, the API returns status 200 and details of the created or updated knowledge base.

files.description: Array of files to be uploaded

400.description: Missing required fields or invalid input

post.description: Create a new use case for a given agent. Supports uploading a file along with other use case details such as name, description, link, and phone numbers.

400.description: Invalid input or missing required fields

500.description: Internal server error while creating use case

post.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/agents/addKnowledgeBase

### API Request Description
This endpoint uploads documents to a knowledge base associated with the authenticated user's organization. Files are stored on S3 and processed via an external API to generate a vector database collection.

files.description: One or more files to upload (PDF, TXT, etc.)

400.description: Missing knowledgeBaseName or no files uploaded

401.description: Unauthorized: User must be logged in and associated with an organization

500.description: File upload failed or invalid response from external API

get.description: Retrieves all available conversation templates for agents. Templates include metadata such as name, description, and type (single or multi-prompt).

200.description: List of conversation templates retrieved successfully

templates.name: Sales Inquiry - Multi-step
templates.description: Guides the customer through a multi-step sales conversation

put.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/agents/{id}/ambient-noise

### Request Description
Updates the ambient noise configuration for a specific agent, including toggling ambient noise, adjusting volume, and specifying audio characteristics.

post.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/auth/google/login

### API Request Description
This endpoint is used to initiate a Google login by sending an HTTP POST request to the specified URL. The request should include the Google authorization code in the request body.

### Request Body
- authCode (string, required): The Google authorization code obtained during the Google authentication process.

### Response Body
The response to this request will include the authentication result or any relevant data based on the successful processing of the Google login request.

parameters.name: authCode
parameters.description: Google authorization code (optional when provided in body)

put.description: Update an existing voice agent's details by its unique identifier. Only the provided fields will be updated.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the voice agent to update

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl --location --request PUT '{{baseUrl}}/api/voices/{id}' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Cookie: auth=<jwt-token>' \
--data '{
  "name": "Emma Updated",
  "description": "Updated description for this voice",
  "speed": 1.2,
  "tags": ["updated", "customer-service", "professional"]
}'

delete.description: Delete a voice agent by its unique identifier. This action is irreversible.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the voice agent to delete

get.description: Retrieve details of a single voice agent by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the voice agent

post.summary: Get Agent IDs by Phone IDs
post.description: This endpoint retrieves agent IDs associated with a list of phone IDs. Useful to map multiple phone numbers to their corresponding agents.

200.description: List of agent IDs retrieved successfully

post.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/agents/unlink-agent

### Request Description
This endpoint removes the association between an agent and a phone by clearing the agentId reference from the phone record.

### Request
- Method: POST
- Content-Type: application/json
- Must include the phoneId of the phone to unlink.

400.description: Bad Request - Missing phoneId or no agent linked

value.message: No agent linked to this phone

post.description: Creates a new voice agent with the given details such as name, gender, type, provider, provider voice ID, pitch, speed, language, tags, sample URL, and description.

value.name: Emma
value.description: Professional female voice with a friendly tone

value.name: Emma
value.description: Professional female voice with a friendly tone

400.description: Bad request - Invalid data or missing fields

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl --location '{{baseUrl}}/api/voices/' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Cookie: auth=<jwt-token>' \
--data '{
  "name": "Emma",
  "gender": "Female",
  "type": "premium",
  "provider": "elevenlabs",
  "provider_voice_id": "21m00Tcm4TlvDq8ikWAM",
  "pitch": 1.0,
  "speed": 1.0,
  "language": "en-US",
  "tags": ["customer-service", "professional"],
  "sample_url": "https://example.com/voice-samples/emma.mp3",
  "description": "Professional female voice with a friendly tone"
}'

get.description: Retrieves a list of available voice agents with details such as name, language support, traits, gender, and metadata.

500.description: Internal server error - Unable to fetch voices

post.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/auth/login

### API Request Description
This API endpoint allows users to log in and obtain an access token for authentication.

### Request Body
- email (string): The email address of the user.
- password (string): The password for the user's account.

### Response Body
Upon successful login, the server responds with a status code of 201 and a JSON object containing the user's information and access token.

get.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/agents/ambient-noise/options

### Request Description
This endpoint retrieves the list of available ambient noise audio configurations that can be applied to enhance the realism of agent voice responses.

### Request
- This is a simple GET request and does not require a request body.
- Must include a valid Authorization header (Bearer token).

post.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/agents/link-agent

### Request Description
This endpoint associates an existing agent with a specific phone by updating the phone record to reference the agent.

### Request
- Method: POST
- Content-Type: application/json
- Must include a valid Authorization header (Bearer token if required) or Cookie header.
- The request body must include the following fields:
  - agentId (string, required): The ID of the agent to link
  - phoneId (string, required): The ID of the phone to be updated
  - agentType (string, optional): Type of agent (e.g., outbound)
  - workflowId (string, optional): Associated workflow ID
  - workflowType (string, optional): Type of workflow (e.g., outbound)
  - type (string, optional): Entity type, usually 'agent'

agentId.description: The ID of the agent to link

phoneId.description: The ID of the phone to be updated

get.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/auth/profile

### Request Description
This endpoint retrieves the profile information of the authenticated user.

### Request
- This is a simple GET request and does not require a request body.
- Must include a valid Authorization header (Bearer token).

put.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/auth/profile

### Request Description
This endpoint allows the authenticated user to update their profile information.

### Request
- Method: PUT
- Content-Type: multipart/form-data
- Must include a valid Authorization header (Bearer token)
- The request body accepts form-data with the following fields:
  - firstName (string, optional)
  - lastName (string, optional)
  - mobile (string, optional)
  - companyName (string, optional)
  - address (string, optional)
  - profilePicture (file, optional)

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl --location --request PUT '{{baseUrl}}/api/auth/profile' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {{authToken}}' \
--form 'firstName="TestUser"' \
--form 'lastName="420"' \
--form 'mobile="1234567890"' \
--form 'companyName="Acme Inc."' \
--form 'address="123 Main Street, New York, NY"' \
--form 'profilePicture=@"/path/to/file"'

post.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/auth/reset-password

### Request Description
This endpoint is used to reset the user's password. The request should be sent as an HTTP POST to the specified URL with the reset token (received via email) and the new password in the request body.

### Request Body
- token (string, required): The reset token received via email.
- newPassword (string, required): The new password to be set.

### Response Description
The response will indicate whether the password reset was successful or failed. On success, a confirmation message is returned. On failure, an error message is provided (e.g., invalid or expired token).

get.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/auth/status

### Request Description
This endpoint is used to retrieve the status of the authentication.

### Request
- No request body is required.
- The request must include a valid Authorization header (Bearer token).

### Response Description
- **200 OK** â€“ The request was successful, and the authentication status is returned in the response body.
- **Error Handling** â€“ If the token is invalid or expired, an error response will be returned.

### Response Body
- status (string): The authentication status.

### Example Response
```json
{
  "status": "approved"
}
```

delete.description: Permanently deletes an agent by its unique identifier. This operation is irreversible. Only authenticated users with appropriate access to the agent or its organization can perform deletions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the agent to delete

message.example: No agent exists for the given ID
An unexpected error occurred during deletion

put.description: Updates the details of an existing agent by ID. Supports updating metadata, call settings, system messages, and tags. Multi-prompt agents have structured systemMessage updates, and role-based restrictions apply for websocketUrl updates.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the agent to update

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl --location --request PUT '{{baseUrl}}/api/agents/6815701194899f4a2b71c0bc' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {{authToken}}' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Cookie: auth=<token>' \
--data '{"agent_name":"Updated Agent Name","description":"Updated description for this agent","tags":["updated","modified"],"callSetting":{"voiceSpeed":1.1,"callTimeout":40}}'

post.description: Simulate a chat session with a specific agent. Send chat history, dynamic variables, and timezone information to get the agent's response.

agentId.description: ID of the agent to test chat with

variable.description: Dynamic variables to inject into agent responses

chat_history.description: List of previous messages in the conversation

timezone.description: Timezone of the user sending the messages

chat_history.content: Hello Viju! This is Zara from i-SON Health. I wanted to remind you that your next medication refill is scheduled for the 25th of May, 2025. Have you had a chance to refill your medication since your last refill on the 10th of May?

response.content: Hello Arvind! How can I assist you today?

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl --location '{{baseUrl}}/api/agents/test-agent-chat' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {{authToken}}' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Cookie: auth=<token>' \
--data '{"agentId":"684135442bc2d87ddfe0697f","variable":{"customer_name":"Arvind"},"chat_history":[{"role":"USER","content":"Hello"},{"role":"AGENT","content":"Hello Viju! This is Zara from i-SON Health..."},{"role":"USER","content":"Bye Bye"}],"timezone":"Asia/Kolkata"}'

get.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/agents/

### API Request Description
This endpoint retrieves the list of agents associated with the authenticated user's organization. Each agent includes details such as their type, status, assigned workflows, and configuration settings.

post.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/agents/

### API Request Description
This endpoint creates a new agent with the specified configuration. The agent can be assigned a voice, call settings, tags, and system messages to guide its behavior.

value.description: AI assistant trained to handle customer inquiries and support tickets
value.startMessage: Hello! I'm your support assistant. How can I help you today?
value.systemMessage: You are a helpful customer support agent for Acme Inc. Your goal is to assist customers with their inquiries about products, orders, and services.

agent.description: AI assistant trained to handle customer inquiries and support tickets
agent.startMessage: Hello! I'm your support assistant. How can I help you today?
agent.systemMessage: You are a helpful customer support agent for Acme Inc. Your goal is to assist customers with their inquiries about products, orders, and services.

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl --location '{{baseUrl}}/api/agents/' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {{authToken}}' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Cookie: auth=<token>' \
--data '{"agent_name":"Customer Support Agent","gender":"Female","type":"premium","capability":"Customer Service","description":"AI assistant trained to handle customer inquiries and support tickets","voice":"60a7b1c2d3e4f5a6b7c8d9e0","callSetting":{"voiceSpeed":1.0,"vocabulary":["support","ticket","refund","order"],"callTimeout":30},"tags":["support","customer-service","help-desk"],"startMessage":"Hello! I'm your support assistant. How can I help you today?","systemMessage":"You are a helpful customer support agent for Acme Inc. Your goal is to assist customers with their inquiries about products, orders, and services.","selectedLanguage":["en-US","en-IN"],"conversationType":"single_prompt"}'

post.description:
Documentation
{{baseUrl}}/api/auth/signup

### API Request Description
This API endpoint allows the user to sign up by providing necessary details such as username, email, password, phone number, team name, and team size.

### Request Body
- username (string): The username of the user.
- email (string): The email address of the user.
- password (string): The password for the user account.
- phoneNumber (string): The phone number of the user.
- teamName (string): The name of the team the user belongs to.
- teamSize (number): The size of the team.

### Response Body
Upon successful execution, the API returns a status code of 201 and a JSON object with the listed fields (see schema).

_id.description: Unique identifier for the ambient noise option

tts_model_id.description: The ID of the text-to-speech model associated with this noise

volume.description: The volume level (0.0 to 1.0) for mixing the ambient noise

audio_file_name.description: Name of the associated audio file

name.description: Friendly name of the ambient noise setting

agentId.description: ID of the agent to test chat with

variable.description: Dynamic variables to inject into agent responses

type.description: Type of the voice (e.g., standard, premium)

provider_voice_id.description: Unique provider identifier for the voice model

sample_url.description: URL to a sample audio file

description.description: Short description of the voice agent
description.example: Professional female voice with a friendly tone

phoneId.description: List of phone IDs to retrieve corresponding agent IDs

agentId.description: Agent ID linked to the phone

enable.description: Whether ambient noise should be enabled

name.description: Name of the ambient noise configuration (e.g., 'office', 'restaurant')

tts_model_id.description: TTS model to use (eleven_turbo_v2_5 or eleven_ultra_v2_5)

conversationType.description: The type of conversation, e.g., 'single_prompt' or 'multi_prompt'. Determines how the system will process the conversation.

systemMessage.description: Configuration object containing common instructions and states for the agent in the conversation.

common.description: Common instructions and metadata for the agent.

agent_information.description: Information describing the agent's role or behavior.
agent_information.example: You are a customer service agent.

states.description: Defines the states in a multi-step conversation and their goals.

goal.description: The goal or objective of the conversation at this state.

isValid.description: Indicates whether the conversation configuration is valid or not

errors.description: List of validation errors, if any

message.description: Status message of the call creation

callId.description: Unique identifier of the created call

agentId.description: ID of the agent associated with the call

name.description: Name of the person or reference for the call

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the call was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the call was last updated

_id.description: Unique identifier for the voice agent

modelId.description: ID of the voice model used

trait.description: Describes the characteristics of the voice

languages.description: Languages supported by the voice agent

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the voice agent was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the voice agent was last updated

userId.description: Unique identifier of the user creating the use case

agentId.description: Unique identifier of the agent associated with this use case

useCaseLink.description: Optional link related to the use case

useCaseDesc.description: Optional description of the use case

file.description: File upload associated with the use case

batchId.description: Batch ID associated with the use case

phoneNumbers.description: Phone numbers linked to the use case

userId.description: Unique identifier of the user to associate with the phone number

phoneNumber.description: Phone number to be added (must be in E.164 format)

_id.description: Unique identifier of the knowledge base

organizationId.description: Identifier of the organization associated with the knowledge base

_id.description: Unique identifier for the voice agent

modelId.description: ID of the voice model used

trait.description: Describes the characteristics of the voice

languages.description: Languages supported by the voice agent

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the voice agent was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the voice agent was last updated

bucketUrl.description: Amazon S3 bucket URL where files are uploaded

vectorDbCollection.description: Generated vector database collection ID for semantic search

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the knowledge base was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the knowledge base was last updated

websocketUrl.description: Super Admin only; must start with wss://

_id.description: Unique identifier for the created voice agent

description.example: Professional female voice with a friendly tone
